sub_topic: Predicting the products of inorganic reactions
message_1: What are the products formed when copper (II) sulfate solution is mixed with sodium hydroxide solution? Write a balanced chemical equation and identify the type of reaction occurring.
message_2:
When copper (II) sulfate solution is mixed with sodium hydroxide solution, the products formed are copper (II) hydroxide and sodium sulfate. The balanced chemical equation for this reaction is:

CuSO₄ (aq) + 2 NaOH (aq) → Cu(OH)₂ (s) + Na₂SO₄ (aq)

The type of reaction occurring here is a double displacement (or metathesis) reaction, where the cations and anions of the two reactants exchange partners to form new products.
